item.title: Vote MPLS & Ethernet for Better Bandwidth
item.description: The 2008 election season is upon us. To determine which candidates best serve your interests, we suggest considering MPLS and Ethernet for reliable bandwidth, improved performance, and reduced costs over 1-3 years. Let’s delve into their platforms to see if they deserve your vote. IP Networking is currently the leading technology. Initially confined to local offices, IP has expanded to WANs at state, regional, and national levels. Today, almost all network designs are centered around IP or Internet Protocol.

item.title: A study conducted by INSEAD has discovered that when shareholders vote on CEO accountability, it leads to higher company returns
item.description: A new study titled “Say Pays! Shareholder Voice and Firm Performance,” published in the Review of Finance, suggests that shareholder votes do improve CEO accountability and reduce unnecessary spending within corporations. The study’s author, Maria Guadalupe, an Associate Professor at INSEAD, found that previous research on the impact of “say-on-pay” policies was inconclusive, possibly due to focusing on periods after say-on-pay became law. Guadalupe’s research examined 250 instances where shareholders of S&P 1500 companies proposed to adopt say-on-pay policies between 2006 and 2010, before such votes were mandatory.

item.title: HungryGoWhere is collecting votes for its inaugural foodie awards
item.description: The inaugural HungryGoWhere Awards voting period has opened. The food review platform HungryGoWhere revealed that public votes will solely decide the 26 award recipients. Those interested in voting have until February 4th to cast their ballots on the awards website. The awards span five categories: Restaurants, Hawkers, Drinks, Occasions, and Best of the Best. After the voting period ends, participants will be entered into a lucky draw.

item.title: Traveloka will introduce awards based on audience participation for Asia's Got Talent
item.description: Traveloka, a popular Southeast Asian travel app, is sponsoring the second season of AXN’s Asia’s Got Talent and introducing the Traveloka Awards. The Traveloka Awards will recognize the contestant with the most compelling background, emphasizing unique talents and strong family and friend connections. Premiering this October, Asiaâ€™s Got Talent on AXN will feature ten episodes, including auditions, semifinals, a finale, and a results show revealing the winner of a $100,000 prize from Traveloka.
